comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? The compiler issues a warning when I pass 5 arguments to the Window.prototype.openDatabase method. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? No warning should be issued. The function call is correct. According to the W3C spec - http://dev.w3.org/html5/webdatabase/#databases - and WebKit implementations, the correct number of arguments is 4 of 5 with the last (the creation callback function) being optional. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Cygwin on Windows 7 x64, compiler-20110615 (currently latest) Please provide any additional information below. In the html5.js extern file is the last argument incorrectly omitted: /** * @param {string} name * @param {string} version * @param {string} description * @param {number} size * @return {Database} */ Window.prototype.openDatabase = function(name, version, description, size) {};
This issue was closed by revision r1255.
